title: Lib Dems will stand aside for Dominic Grieve, as polling predicts a Boris Johnson majority
text:
The Liberal Democrats have agreed an election pact not to stand against Tory rebel Dominic Grieve, as research by a pro-Remain campaign group predicted Boris Johnson will win a majority of 44.

Best For Britain, which supports a second referendum, canvassed 46,000 voters on a constituency by constituency basis and found that the Tories are currently on course to win 364 seats, with Labour taking 189 and Lib Dems winning 23.

However, the group said that if just 30 per cent of Remain supporters vote tactically, a Remain coalition of Labour, the Liberal Democrats, SNP and minor parties could win a slim majority of four.

Tactical voting is seen by the Opposition as the only way to keep Boris Johnson...
